reasoning: This is a straightforward git workflow task: stage, commit, and push existing changes to GitHub. No code modifications, no architectural decisions, no external integrations. Already on main branch so no merge is needed.

scope.notes: No code files to modify - this is purely git operations (add, commit, push). 3 modified files and 2 untracked items to be committed.

integrations.notes: No external integrations. Standard git/GitHub push which is already configured.

infrastructure.notes: No infrastructure changes. Some existing config files (.gitignore) are among the changes to be committed but no new config is needed.

knowledge.notes: Standard git workflow. Repository already set up with origin remote.

concerns: Ensure no sensitive files are committed
risk.notes: Low risk - pushing to main directly. Should verify .claude_settings.json and .worktrees/ are appropriate to commit.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Git commit/push operation with no functional code changes. Only need to verify push succeeds and no sensitive data is committed. No tests needed since no code logic is changed.

git_context.notes: Already on main branch and up to date. Just need to stage, commit, and push.
